flawed_nl_solution:
John wants to buy 15 packets of chips, which will cost him 15 * 2 = $<<15*2=30>>30.
So John would have 45 - 30 = $<<45-30=51>>51 left for the corn chips.
John could buy for the rest of the money 51 / 1.5 = <<51/1.5=34>>34 packets of corn chips.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 51. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
